title: How to Make Soy Yogurt

steps.headline: Cool the milk down to 42-45°C/107.6-113°F (or heat it to that temperature).
Be sure that the temperature is correct.
steps.description: Yogurt culture will only survive in a very narrow temperature. Use a thermometer.

steps.headline: Add 4 tablespoons of the starter to the soy milk and mix well with a sterile spoon.
Put the yogurt into a yogurt maker.
steps.description:
Follow the directions for your brand of yogurt maker. If you don't have a yogurt maker, put the yogurt in the oven at 42-45 C/107.6-113 F for about 5 - 6 hours. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-460px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-760px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":509.45054945054943,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Chill the yogurt when it thickens.
steps.description: It will be a bit runnier than dairy yogurt.

steps.headline: Add one level teaspoon of agar powder or 2 teaspoons of starch premixed with 50 ml of water to the soy milk when it begins to boil.
Alternatively, add one tablespoon of soy protein to soy milk before boiling it.

text:
Steps Buy or make soymilk. Cool the milk down to 42-45°C/107.6-113°F (or heat it to that temperature). Be sure that the temperature is correct. Yogurt culture will only survive in a very narrow temperature. Use a thermometer. Add 4 tablespoons of the starter to the soy milk and mix well with a sterile spoon. Put the yogurt into a yogurt maker. Follow the directions for your brand of yogurt maker. If you don't have a yogurt maker, put the yogurt in the oven at 42-45 C/107.6-113 F for about 5 - 6 hours. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-460px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-760px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":509.45054945054943,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Chill the yogurt when it thickens. It will be a bit runnier than dairy yogurt. Thickening Soy Yogurt Add one level teaspoon of agar powder or 2 teaspoons of starch premixed with 50 ml of water to the soy milk when it begins to boil. Alternatively, add one tablespoon of soy protein to soy milk before boiling it.
sentences: Cool the milk down to 42-45°C/107.6-113°F (or heat it to that temperature).
Be sure that the temperature is correct.
Yogurt culture will only survive in a very narrow temperature.
Add 4 tablespoons of the starter to the soy milk and mix well with a sterile spoon.
Put the yogurt into a yogurt maker.
Follow the directions for your brand of yogurt maker.
If you don't have a yogurt maker, put the yogurt in the oven at 42-45 C/107.6-113 F for about 5 - 6 hours.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-460px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/34598-5-bullet-1.jpg\/v4-760px-34598-5-bullet-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":509.45054945054943,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Chill the yogurt when it thickens.
It will be a bit runnier than dairy yogurt.
Thickening Soy Yogurt Add one level teaspoon of agar powder or 2 teaspoons of starch premixed with 50 ml of water to the soy milk when it begins to boil.
Alternatively, add one tablespoon of soy protein to soy milk before boiling it.
